elements.label: I am composing a Lantern Song
A Bright Motif
elements.description: I find myself whistling this while I ponder a difficult problems. The insight it brings is often as sharp as its thrills

elements.label: The Lily Kings Sonnata
elements.description: This song starts softly, rising consistently in both tone and timbre, until it crescendo's in incredibly pure whistle-tones. It is famous for waking rousing addicts from their stupor, yet dangerous for a too receptive mind.

elements.label: Brigid's Chant
elements.description: She whispered these words to the fire, she did. She speaks them to the steel, she does. She shouts them to end the night, she will.

elements.label: A Valkyrian Hymn
elements.description: Rise up! For your battle is not over. Rise up, for your war has not been won. As long as you have breath in you, rise up and hiss this to your enemies.

elements.label: The Issian March
elements.description: The song recounts the many reasons the army heading to Issus had for fighting, the betrayal, the lies, the villainy of enemy. It ends with an ironic or chilling reprise in which the same lines are sung by the opposing forces.

elements.label: I am composing a Winter Song

elements.description: These dull dark tones remind me of all I have lost, yet tears refuse to roll down my face.

elements.label: A Chilly Elegy
elements.description: It is sung not for those who have passed, but those who have yet to. It is rarely performed in groups, but acknoweldges that all will sing the same tune, eventually.

slots.label: A Crowd

elements.label: Requiem For The Stone
elements.description: It is a long and bitter song, which grinds your voice to a hoarse rocky whisper. You sing of the five siblings you buried, and of the terrible compromise you had to make. But your duty remains, and therefore, so shall you.

elements.label: Ceaseless Rhythms
elements.description: Step like thunder, shake like reeds. Take your partner and go round, and round and round. And Again! Step like thunder, shiver like reeds...

elements.label: Lullaby for the Sleepless Gods
elements.description: Oh king of the Sky, sleep no more. Oh Queens of Sea and Shore, death won't touch you. Oh Maiden of the Woods, you will be renewed.

elements.label: A Scarlet Solo

elements.label: Ballad for the Pine-knight
elements.description: In the first 26 verses I will detail the Pine Knight's exploits in salivating detail. The last seven are harder to perform, but more rewarding. In them, his self-flagellation and subsequent transformation must be both felt and chastised. Avoid peeling at loose skin after finishing the set.
